page.title: 07Churches-Roman Catholic (C)
page.content: The Cathedral,a Victorian building,can accomodate 600 people.Mass is said here four times on Sundays and twice each weekday.The 240ft spire is a local landmark.In May l985 the Cathedral was the setting for a colourful gathering of church dignitaries and laity when Bishop John Brewer was concecrated as successor to Bishop Foley.Adjoining the Cathedral is a convent of SHCJ nuns,who work in the parish.The present parish priest is Mgr F.Slattery and there are two curates.There are 1800 Catholics in the parish.A modern Social Centre is the venue for many parish activities. St Bernadette's at Bowerham is a modern church accomodating 500 people in a parish of 800 Catholics.A feature of the building is the mural of the Ascension by John Piper.Mass is said daily and twice each Sunday.The present parish priest is Fr M.Tulley.
